title: Exception to applicability of chapter
context: [§343-5.5] Exception to applicability of chapter. (a) Notwithstanding any other law to the contrary, for any primary action that requires a permit or approval that is not subject to a discretionary consent and that involves a secondary action that is ancillary and limited to the installation, improvement, renovation, construction, or development of infrastructure within an existing public right-of-way or highway, that secondary action shall be exempt from this chapter; provided that the applicant for the primary action shall submit documentation from the appropriate agency confirming that no further discretionary approvals are required. (b) As used in this section: &ldquo;Discretionary consent&rdquo; means: (1) An action as defined in section 343-2; or (2) An approval from a decision-making authority in an agency, which approval is subject to a public hearing. &ldquo;Infrastructure&rdquo; includes waterlines and water facilities, wastewater lines and wastewater facilities, gas lines and gas facilities, drainage facilities, electrical, communications, telephone, and cable television utilities, and highway, roadway, and driveway improvements. &ldquo;Primary action&rdquo; means an action outside of the highway or public right-of-way that is on private property. &ldquo;Secondary action&rdquo; means an action involving infrastructure within the highway or public right-of-way. [L 2012, c 312, §1]
